html:
Adds: EQT Updates, SoftBank Group Corp

Feb 8 (Reuters) - The following bids, mergers, acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1430 GMT on Tuesday:


** SoftBank Group Corp 9984.T has shelved its blockbuster sale of Arm Ltd to U.S. chipmaker Nvidia Corp NVDA.O valued at up to $80 billion citing regulatory hurdles and will instead seek to list the company.

(Full Story)


** European buyout firm EQT EQTAB.ST is working with advisers to prepare the sale of French water management firm Saur in a deal that could value France's third-biggest water firm at about 3 billion euros ($3.43 billion), people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

(Full Story)


** French telecom operator Orange ORANG.PA is exploring merging its Spanish unit, the country's second largest, with local rival MasMovil, Expansion newspaper reported , citing unidentified market sources.

(Full Story)


** Shares of Brazilian telecom Oi OIBR3.SA plummeted more than 10% on Monday on a challenge to the company's 16.5 billion reais ($3.14 billion) sale of its mobile operations to rivals TIM Participacoes SA TIMS3.SA, Telefonica Brasil's Vivo VIVT4.SA and Claro.

(Full Story)


** A subsidiary of Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O has secured a warrant to acquire 39.6 million shares in Velodyne Lidar Inc VLDR.O, the sensor maker said on Monday, more than doubling its share price in after-market trade.

(Full Story)


** Budget carriers Frontier Group Holdings ULCC.O and Spirit Airlines Inc SAVE.N on Monday unveiled plans to create the fifth-largest U.S. airline in a $2.9 billion tie-up likely to tighten competition against traditional carriers.

(Full Story)


** Canadian oil and gas producer Crescent Point Energy Corp CPG.TO is looking to sell some of its assets in Alberta and Saskatchewan that could fetch around C$500 million ($394 million), according to an industry source and marketing documents seen by Reuters on Monday.

(Full Story)

** Brazilian shopping mall operator BR Malls Participacoes SA BRML3.SA resumed talks to partially combine its portfolio with Ancar after rejecting a merger offer from Aliansce Sonae earlier this year, newspaper Valor Economico reported on Monday.

(Full Story)


** Brazilian healthcare company Hapvida HAPV3.SA said on Monday the acquisition of Notre Dame Intermedica GNDI3.SA is likely to add 1.38 billion reais ($259 million) to its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization by 2024.

(Full Story)




(Compiled by Mehnaz Yasmin and Rajarshi Roy in Bengaluru; Editing by Amy Caren Daniel)

(( Mehnaz.Yasmin@thomsonreuters.com ;))
